title: Mom lied son was sick and made him undergo major but unnecessary surgeries
text:
Kaylene Bowen-Wright was sentenced to six years in prison for causing bodily harm to her son by forcing him to undergo numerous unnecessary medical procedures. (Picture: WPBF)

A mother is behind bars after she made her son get 13 unnecessary major surgeries after faking his illnesses.

Kaylene Bowen-Wright was sentenced to six years in jail on Friday in Dallas, Texas after she pleaded guilty to causing serious bodily harm to her son Christopher, who is now 10.

Authorities say Christopher suffered from blood infections and radiation he had been exposed to because of the needless procedures.

Christopher also suffers ‘serious mental impairment from the suspect continually teaching (Christopher) that he is ill’ and from putting him a wheelchair at an early age, according to court documents.

The problems began 11 days after Christopher was born, when his mother was seen pouring out milk that he did not finish and ‘lying to medical professionals that (Christopher) had taken the entire contents of his bottle.’

Over the next eight years, Bowen-Wright took her son from doctor to doctor. She lied about Christopher’s medical history and made him go through needless tests and procedures, including hooking him up to feeding tubes, central lines, and other ports, according to WPBF.

Christopher ‘developed life threatening blood infections in the central lines, on two separate occasions, which required the complainant to be admitted to the intensive care unit,’ court documents say.

The boy ended up in hospice care when he was five-years-old, where Bowen-Wright signed a ‘do not resuscitate’ order for her son.

He was discharged in 2015 after his mother did not listen to doctors who recommended an eight-week hospital stay for Christopher to be taken off feeding tubes, oxygen, and IV hydration to start living ‘a somewhat normal life.’

Bowen-Wright reportedly lied and said her insurance would not cover the stay.

Bowen-Wright once even posted a picture of her son in a Make A Wish T-shirt. (Picture: WPBF)

The boy began eating normally when he was taken off his feeding tube after contracting his third life-threatening blood infection. He was released, but his mother transferred him to another medical center.

Christopher’s ailments were ‘never witnessed by medical providers,’ according to court documents. It is unclear why no one failed to check whether he was sick before cutting him open on the operating table.

Woman 'hurled malnourished puppy out of car window'

‘The complainant had no seizure activity, no choking or aspirating on food and showed no fatigue. Instead the complainant was up and playing most of the time in the hospital.’

He was released to a foster care home after being taken out of his mother’s care.
description: Kaylene Bowen-Wright was sentenced to six years in jail after she pleaded guilty to causing serious bodily harm to her son Christopher.
